sense.def: Alternative Names niu pi feng xuan 牛皮風癬 , oxhide wind xuan -illness; niu pi wan xuan 牛皮頑癬 , stubborn ox-hide xuan -illness; niu pi xue xuan 牛皮血癬 , ox-hide blood xuan -illness; niu pi e xuan 牛皮惡癬 , malign ox-hide xuan -illness. Pathological Condition of xuan 癬 , xuan -illness

a) , with a stubborn, thick and hard lesion, reminiscent of an ox’s neck skin. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 137: 牛犬所飲、刀刃磨淬之餘水，取以盥 濯，毒氣傳人，亦能生癬，故得於牛毒者，狀似牛皮。於諸癬中最為 黶 厚邪毒之甚者，俗謂之牛皮癬 , “If for washing one uses the water given oxen and dogs to drink, or the water running from a stone used for grinding knives, poisonous qi may enter [one’s organism] and cause xuan -illness. Those resulting from the poison of oxen will appear as ox-hide. Among all types of xuan -illness, those with a very numb and thick skin and with the most evil poison, they are commonly called ‘ ox-hide xuan -illness ’”.
